feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502: Custom tile for Custom UI5 application with parameters
entry.content:
Dear SAP experts,

I have an issue with the Fiori app Display Line Item Entry (F2218) , which does not accept the URL parameters "P_FromPostingDate" and "P_ToPostingDate".

In on-premise systems I was able to solve this by creating a new tile as a copy of the standard one and adding the required parameters.

The problem is that in S/4HANA Public Cloud there is no SAP Fiori Launchpad Designer, so I cannot create a new tile in this way.

I used the following reference to create a Custom Tile, but this only works for external applications and does not allow me to add new parameters.

Â¿How can I create a tile with parameters in S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502?

Thank you very much.

Best regards,

entry.content:

Am i missing any config ?

entry.title: Unable to login during connecting ABAP service instance to Cloud environment
entry.content:
Hi,
I have an ABAP cloud instance in my BTP trial account.
From Eclipse editor, when i am trying to connect the ABAP service instance for connecting to the cloud environment, I am able to specify the ABAP service instance URL, but in the next step, when i am trying to login via 'Open Logon Page in Browser' i am NOT ABLE to login even after giving the correct credentials. I am using same user (P user) for BTP trail account. Its throwing me invalid credential errors. Can anyone tell me what's going wrong?

I am getting the pop up as shown in attached below: Its not even showing if user +pwd is right or wrong.

entry.title: Skip step in flexible PO workflow
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

We have a requirement to implement Flexible PO approval process. We have a bespoke table with three levels of approval. Therefore, we have written logic in BADI-MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2 for agent determination. The approval rationale is like below.
Variance  -  difference between the standard price of the material and the item's net price.

If the difference is between 30% and 50%, go to approver 1.
If there is a difference between 50% and 90%, go to approvers 1 and 2.
If GT 90%, go to approvers 1 + 2 + 3.

Three-level approvals are predefined in the Manage Workflows in Purchase Orders steps.

 

We have a scenario where variance is falling between 30-50 which means we will have only 1 level approval.  So when control goes to level 2 , the approvers table will be empty and as agent determination is mandatory the system throws an exception. Ideally when condition is satisfied rest of the steps need to be skipped ( level 2 and 3 in this case ).

Currently we have a condition at workflow level as we need automatic approval if the variance is less than 30%.

Since BADI only allows for one condition ID (SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF), we are unable to add another condition for step-level control.

We are at a standstill and unable to proceed, went through relevant blogs but was unable to find anything.
Has anyone worked on a requirement like this before?

Please let me  if any information is needed further.

Thank you

Regards,

Karthik

entry.title: Sap_payslip_de_o Hrforms payslip custom/copied infostar sign conversion
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I am working on Germany SAP payslip i.e sap_payslip_de_o in Hrforms

For custom changes i had copied the payslip in z* form.

For convenience i had copied some standard infonets then copied some stardard infostars to differentiate the wagetypes.

But if i am maintaining the wagetype in the infostar provided by SAP i am getting correct sign expected,

But if i am copying the same sap infostar and maintaining the wagetype there i am not getting correct sign expected.

 

Where should i need to maintain the sign conversion rule for that and ,please let me know the path.

Thanks in advance 

HCM Payroll #hcm germany #hr abap ABAP Development #hcm payslip

entry.title: abapGit plug-in to import the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario fails "Change recording must be activat
entry.content:
@CarineTchoutouo @Andre_Fischer 

Hi guys

I have SAP system S/4 HANA PUBLIC CLOUD.   I have Eclipse installed with the latest software updates as of 11th Sept 2025 eg. ABAP Development tool v3.52

I am encountering an issue when using the abapGit plug-in in ABAP Development Tools (ADT) in Eclipse to import the ABAP Flight Reference Scenario (https://github.com/SAP-samples/abap-platform-refscen-flight.git) into an ABAP Cloud Project in our S/4HANA Cloud public edition system. The import process fails with the error: "Change recording must be activated for package /DMO/FLIGHT_REUSE." Upon investigation, the abapGit Repository import process is unable to create it. I need assistance to resolve this issue and successfully import the SFLIGHT objects (e.g., /DMO/I_Flight, /DMO/I_Travel_U) for use in an AMDP class.

Following this abap-platform-refscen-flight/README.md at ABAP-platform-cloud Â· SAP-samples/abap-platform-refscen-flight

I have done as instructed but I am getting that error . I have seen SAP note 3630488 - Adt Package Builder: Package creation not possible because of missing Recording Changes Flag - SAP for Me
The package creation wizard was reworked in release SAP BTP 2508, so that it now requires the new ADT client 3.52  - But I am on that version.

entry.title: Create a parked invoice(MIR7) based on a purchase order (BAPI_INCOMINGINVOICE_PARK).
entry.content:
Hello, 

 

I have a requirement to create a parked invoice based on a PO so i opted to use the BAPI 'BAPI_INCOMINGINVOICE_PARK'.

My problem is that when i use the table SELECTPO to assign the PO to the invoice it doesn't retrieve the items of the PO like in the screenshot be

I'am sharing the code i used to create a parked invoice using the FM above:

DATA: ls_headerdata TYPE bapi_incinv_create_header.

ls_headerdata-doc_date = '20250812'.
ls_headerdata-pstng_date = '20250812'.
ls_headerdata-doc_type = 'KR'. 
ls_headerdata-currency = 'EUR'.
ls_headerdata-comp_code = '1000'. 
ls_headerdata-ref_doc_no = 'TEST NEW modif'.

ls_headerdata-diff_inv = ls_ekko-lifnr.
ls_headerdata-PMNTTRMS = 'XXXX'. 
ls_headerdata-gross_amount = 1100.
ls_headerdata-invoice_ind = 'X'.
ls_headerdata-calc_tax_ind = 'X'.

* SelectPo
data lt_selectpo type STANDARD TABLE OF BAPI_INCINV_SELECT_PO.
data ls_selectpo type BAPI_INCINV_SELECT_PO.
ls_selectpo-po_number = '4500000xxx'.
ls_selectpo-po_item = '00010'.
append ls_selectpo to lt_selectpo.

CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_INCOMINGINVOICE_PARK'
EXPORTING
headerdata = ls_headerdata
IMPORTING
invoicedocnumber = lv_invoicedocno
fiscalyear = lv_fiscalyear
TABLES
itemdata = lt_itemdata
taxdata = lt_taxdata
selectpo = lt_selectpo
return = lt_return.
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
EXPORTING
wait = abap_true.
"--- Check Return Messages
LOOP AT lt_return INTO ls_return.
WRITE: / ls_return-type, ls_return-message.
ENDLOOP.

 

Does anyone have any idea on how to do it ?

 

Thanks In advance

Mohamed

entry.title: How to create ODATA v4 POST API where it will take input as a structure and send back array of data
entry.content:

And this I want to create using ODATA v4 with latest ABAP. 

Can someone help me by providing some working sample piece of code and steps which needs to be followed?

I appreciate your response in advance.

Regards,                                                                                                                                                                             Omkar

entry.title: Custom Entity as ABAP Cloud form data provider leading entity
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Can a ABAP RAP custom entity be used as a leading entity of a form data provider? I am working on embedded steampunk of S/4HANA Cloud 2508 version and have built a form object with a service definition where I have exposed a custom entity as a leading entity but the form object is erroring out.

I have added necessary annotations to service definition and the custom entity respectively. These annotations works for a CDS view entity but not for a custom entity or a CDS view defined using 'define view' syntax.

Does it mean that a custom entity cannot be used in form object?

@PascalBremer 

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: BADI to validate all the warehouse tasks in one go at the time of creation via /scwm/todlv_o
entry.content: Can someone please help with a badi which gets triggered when create or create save buttons are clicked at the time of warehouse task creation either from the /scwm/prdo outbound delivery follow on function or from t code /scwm/todlv_o. It should also let us display the validation or error messages to user in the log section.The badi should get triggered for all the warehouse tasks at once and not one at a time as the requirement is to let the user create the warehouse task for all the line items or for none. Only if all the line items are selected by the user then only we should proceed for warehouse task creation for all line items else no WHT to be created.

entry.title: Getting the error "IDoc was posted, see import log" using BAPI_DANGEROUSGOOD_SAVREPMUL for DGP1
entry.content:
Hi all,

I am working on the Dangerous Goods creation process using the BAPI BAPI_DANGEROUSGOOD_SAVREPMUL (DGP1). After retrieving the data with BAPI_DANGEROUSGOOD_GETDETAIL, I passed all the values to the creation BAPI. However, I encountered an error message: "IDoc was posted, see import log."

Upon reviewing the IDoc log in transaction WE02, I found the error message: "Problem with SOAP class" (please see the attached screenshots for reference).

Could anyone provide insight into what this error means and how I can resolve it?

Thank you in advance for your help!

Best regards,
Shubham Kumar Mishra

 



ABAP Development

entry.title: SAP Build Apps â Deep Insert & Minimal Payload with S/4HANA OData (Create Inbound Deliveries)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

Iâm working on a scenario where SAP Build Apps connects to an S/4HANA OData service (API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV/A_InbDeliveryHeader). The goal is to create inbound deliveries from Build Apps with a minimal payload and include line items via a deep entity (to_DeliveryDocumentItem).

Challenge:

Create Record node

  • Forces mapping of all ~107 fields of the header entity, even if only 2â3 fields are needed.
  • Does not expose navigation properties (deep entities) for mapping.

HTTP Destination Request

  • Facing issues with endpoint resolution.
  • The relative path seems to end up in the request body instead of the URL.
  • Calls return 400 Bad Request.

Example payload I tried (items only):

 

{
  "to_DeliveryDocumentItem": {
    "results": [
      {
        "ActualDeliveryQuantity": "1000",
        "ReferenceSDDocument": "4500000763",
        "ReferenceSDDocumentItem": "10"
      },
      {
        "ActualDeliveryQuantity": "800",
        "ReferenceSDDocument": "4500000763",
        "ReferenceSDDocumentItem": "20"
      }
    ]
  }
}

 

Questions

  1. Is it a known limitation that Create Record does not support deep entities or minimal payloads?

  2. What is the recommended approach in Build Apps for:

    • Deep insert (header + items)

    • Partial updates (sending only required fields)

  3. For HTTP Destination Request, where should the relative path be set so it becomes config.url instead of being placed inside the body?

  4. Does the inbound delivery API support POST with deep entities, and what are the minimum required header fields?

  5. Any specifics to consider (e.g., $batch, sap-client, CSRF token handling)?

If anyone has a working example (endpoint + headers + minimal payload), it would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

Best regards,
Aman K.

entry.title: bapi_pr_create return error
entry.content:
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Report ZUPLOADER_PR_CREATE001
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
REPORT zpr_upload_pr.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Types
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_upload,
         pr_type     TYPE bapimereqheader-pr_type,
         preq_item   TYPE bapimereqitem-preq_item,
         pur_group   TYPE bapimereqitem-pur_group,
         preq_name   TYPE bapimereqitem-short_text,
         material    TYPE bapimereqitem-material,
         plant       TYPE bapimereqitem-plant,
         store_loc   TYPE bapimereqitem-store_loc,
         trackingno  TYPE bapimereqitem-trackingno,
         quantity    TYPE bapimereqitem-quantity,
         deliv_date  TYPE bapimereqitem-DELIV_DATE,  " Excel format dd.mm.yyyy
         preq_price  TYPE bapimereqitem-preq_price,
         acctasscat  TYPE bapimereqitem-acctasscat,
         currency    TYPE bapimereqitem-currency,
         serial_no   TYPE bapimereqaccount-serial_no,
         asset_no    TYPE bapimereqaccount-asset_no,
         sub_number  TYPE bapimereqaccount-sub_number,
       END OF ty_upload.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_log,
         preq_item TYPE bapimereqitem-preq_item,
         number    TYPE bapimereqheader-preq_no,
         message   TYPE bapiret2-message,
         type      TYPE bapiret2-type,
       END OF ty_log.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Data
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
DATA: gt_upload TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_upload,
      gt_log    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_log.

* BAPI structures
DATA: lt_pritem      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqitemimp,
      lt_pritemx     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqitemx,
      lt_praccount   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqaccount,
      lt_praccountx  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapimereqaccountx,
      lt_return      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiret2.

DATA: ls_pritem      TYPE bapimereqitemimp,
      ls_pritemx     TYPE bapimereqitemx,
      ls_praccount   TYPE bapimereqaccount,
      ls_praccountx  TYPE bapimereqaccountx,
      ls_return      TYPE bapiret2,
      ls_prheader    TYPE BAPIMEREQHEADER,
      ls_prheaderx   TYPE bapimereqheaderx,
      lv_preq_number TYPE BAPIMEREQHEADER-PREQ_NO.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Selection screen
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
PARAMETERS: p_file TYPE rlgrap-filename OBLIGATORY.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR p_file.
  PERFORM f4_file.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* File selection popup
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM f4_file.
  DATA: lt_file TYPE filetable,
        lv_rc   TYPE i,
        ls_file TYPE file_table.

  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_open_dialog
    EXPORTING
      file_filter = 'Excel Files (*.xls;*.xlsx)|*.xls;*.xlsx|'
    CHANGING
      file_table  = lt_file
      rc          = lv_rc.

  IF sy-subrc = 0 AND lv_rc > 0.
    READ TABLE lt_file INTO ls_file INDEX 1.
    p_file = ls_file-filename.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Main logic
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
START-OF-SELECTION.
  PERFORM read_excel.
  PERFORM create_pr.
  PERFORM display_log.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Read Excel
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM read_excel.
  DATA: lt_raw TYPE truxs_t_text_data.

  CALL FUNCTION 'TEXT_CONVERT_XLS_TO_SAP'
    EXPORTING
      i_line_header        = 'X'
      i_tab_raw_data       = lt_raw
      i_filename           = p_file
    TABLES
      i_tab_converted_data = gt_upload
    EXCEPTIONS
      conversion_failed    = 1
      OTHERS               = 2.

  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    MESSAGE 'Error reading Excel file' TYPE 'E'.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
* Create PR
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM create_pr.
  DATA: ls_upload TYPE ty_upload,
        lv_date   TYPE sy-datum,
        lv_asset_no TYPE bapimereqaccount-asset_no,
        ls_log    TYPE ty_log.  " <-- New: Work area for the log table

  LOOP AT gt_upload INTO ls_upload.

    " Clear BAPI structures and tables for each new PR
    CLEAR: ls_prheader, ls_prheaderx, lv_preq_number.
    REFRESH: lt_pritem, lt_pritemx, lt_praccount, lt_praccountx, lt_return.

    " Header
    ls_prheader-pr_type  = ls_upload-pr_type.
    ls_prheaderx-pr_type = 'X'.

    " Convert date (dd.mm.yyyy â yyyymmdd)
    CLEAR lv_date.
*    IF ls_upload-deliv_date IS NOT INITIAL.
*      CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERT_DATE_TO_INTERNAL'
*        EXPORTING
*          date_external = ls_upload-deliv_date
*        IMPORTING
*          date_internal = lv_date
*        EXCEPTIONS
*          OTHERS        = 1.
*    ENDIF.

    " Item
    CLEAR ls_pritem.
    ls_pritem-preq_item  = ls_upload-preq_item.
    ls_pritem-pur_group  = ls_upload-pur_group.
    ls_pritem-short_text = ls_upload-preq_name.
    ls_pritem-material   = ls_upload-material.
    ls_pritem-plant      = ls_upload-plant.
    ls_pritem-store_loc  = ls_upload-store_loc.
    ls_pritem-trackingno = ls_upload-trackingno.
    ls_pritem-quantity   = ls_upload-quantity.
    ls_pritem-deliv_date =  ls_upload-deliv_date.
    ls_pritem-preq_price = ls_upload-preq_price.
    ls_pritem-acctasscat = ls_upload-acctasscat.
    ls_pritem-currency   = ls_upload-currency.
    APPEND ls_pritem TO lt_pritem.

    CLEAR ls_pritemx.
    ls_pritemx-preq_item  = ls_upload-preq_item.
    ls_pritemx-pur_group  = 'X'.
    ls_pritemx-short_text = 'X'.
    ls_pritemx-material   = 'X'.
    ls_pritemx-plant      = 'X'.
    ls_pritemx-store_loc  = 'X'.
    ls_pritemx-trackingno = 'X'.
    ls_pritemx-quantity   = 'X'.
    ls_pritemx-deliv_date = 'X'.
    ls_pritemx-preq_price = 'X'.
    ls_pritemx-acctasscat = 'X'.
    ls_pritemx-currency   = 'X'.
    APPEND ls_pritemx TO lt_pritemx.


" Account assignment if needed
IF ls_upload-acctasscat IS NOT INITIAL.

  DATA(lv_asset) = ls_upload-asset_no.
    CONDENSE lv_asset NO-GAPS.
    WHILE strlen( lv_asset ) < 12.
      lv_asset = |0{ lv_asset }|.
    ENDWHILE.

    ENDIF.

  CLEAR ls_praccount.
CLEAR ls_praccount.
ls_praccount-preq_item  = ls_upload-preq_item.
ls_praccount-serial_no  = ls_upload-serial_no.
ls_praccount-asset_no   = lv_asset.          " <-- Use padded value
ls_praccount-sub_number = ls_upload-sub_number.
APPEND ls_praccount TO lt_praccount.

  CLEAR ls_praccountx.
ls_praccountx-preq_item = ls_upload-preq_item.
IF ls_upload-serial_no IS NOT INITIAL.
  ls_praccountx-serial_no = 'X'.
ENDIF.
IF lv_asset IS NOT INITIAL.                 " <-- check padded variable
  ls_praccountx-asset_no  = 'X'.
ENDIF.
IF ls_upload-sub_number IS NOT INITIAL.
  ls_praccountx-sub_number = 'X'.
ENDIF.
APPEND ls_praccountx TO lt_praccountx.


    " Call BAPI
    CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_PR_CREATE'        "PRITEM
      EXPORTING
        prheader   = ls_prheader
        prheaderx  = ls_prheaderx
      IMPORTING
        number     = lv_preq_number
      TABLES
        pritem     = lt_pritem
        pritemx    = lt_pritemx
        praccount  = lt_praccount
        praccountx = lt_praccountx
        return     = lt_return.

    " Commit and log
    IF lv_preq_number IS NOT INITIAL.
      CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
        EXPORTING wait = 'X'.

      " Populate the log work area and append
*      CLEAR ls_log.
*      ls_log-preq_item = ls_upload-preq_item.
*      ls_log-number    = lv_preq_number.
*      ls_log-message   = |PR { lv_preq_number } created|.
*      ls_log-type      = 'S'.
*      APPEND ls_log TO gt_log.
*    ELSE.
*      LOOP AT lt_return INTO ls_return.
*        " Populate the log work area and append
*        CLEAR ls_log.
*        ls_log-preq_item = ls_upload-preq_item.
*        ls_log-number    = space.
*        ls_log-message   = ls_return-message.
*        ls_log-type      = ls_return-type.
*        APPEND ls_log TO gt_log.
*      ENDLOOP.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM display_log.
  cl_demo_output=>display( lt_return ).
ENDFORM.      i m getting return error that enter asset no. but in debugging it fetch right  value but bapi returning error

entry.title: Error Occurred during reprint processing via TCode VF31 for SAP Billing Doc
entry.content: Error Occurred during reprint processing via tcode VF31 for SAP Billing Doc- output type RD00.Getting the error as table row is greater than 176cm. On checking with technical team, they mentioned that in a single row, it is trying to print 433 serial numbers (line items) which is more than SAP standard limit allowed. they have checked the execution, and it is allowing 381 serial numbers only. Please suggest a workaround for this case to solve the issue.
